articles.title: 7 password managers to help keep your apps safe
articles.description: Passwords still seem to be the most popular method of ensuring that the right person is using the right app or service, despite the slow adoption of passkeys, which are considered more secure. And because we should be using different ones for each device and/or app, the best way to track all of them is […]
articles.author: Barbara Krasnoff

articles.title: We found stuff AI is pretty good at
articles.description: Tech companies keep telling everyone that this or that AI feature is going to change everything. But when you press them for examples, real, concrete examples of how those AI tools should be used, the answers tend to be lackluster. Sometimes AI tools feel so open-ended, it's hard to know where to start or what […]
articles.author: Victoria Song

articles.title: How big trucks and SUVs gobbled up the entire auto industry
articles.description: How it started When I was growing up in the Midwest, everyone I knew drove small cars. My dad had a light pink Volvo 240, my mom drove a Dodge Dart, and my grandmother had a 1988 Honda Accord - which would eventually become my first car. We lived in the suburbs, so almost no […]
articles.author: Andrew J. Hawkins

articles.title: Inside the automated warehouse where robots are packing your groceries
articles.description: It's the lack of noise you notice first. There's no clatter of equipment, rumble of engines, or chatter of coworkers. Only the low hum of electronics. For an industrial space, this is eerily quiet, but it makes sense in a building where robots might outnumber people. I'm at a warehouse - or customer fulfilment center […]
articles.author: Dominic Preston

articles.title: Ditching my phone for an LTE smartwatch was a humbling experience
articles.description: Leaving the house without my phone is the stuff of nightmares. Leaving the house without my phone on purpose? Are you kidding? What if I need to take a picture of something? What will I look at if I need to wait in line? What if disaster strikes or a War of the Worlds happens? […]
articles.author: Allison Johnson

articles.title: Sex is getting scrubbed from the internet, but a billionaire can sell you AI nudes
articles.description: In the fascinating new reality of the internet, teen girls can't learn about periods on Reddit and indie artists can't sell smutty games on Itch.io, but a military contractor will make you nonconsensual deepfakes of Taylor Swift taking her top off for $30 a month. Early Tuesday, Elon Musk's xAI launched a new image and […]

articles.description: Hi, friends! Welcome to Installer No. 93, your guide to the best and Verge-iest stuff in the world.
